trans-unit.source: Create Windows-based Hadoop clusters in HDInsight | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Create Windows-based Hadoop clusters in HDInsight | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Learn how to create clusters for Azure HDInsight.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to create clusters for Azure HDInsight.

trans-unit.source: Create Windows-based Hadoop clusters in HDInsight
trans-unit.target: Create Windows-based Hadoop clusters in HDInsight

trans-unit.source: Learn how to plan for creating HDInsight clusters.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to plan for creating HDInsight clusters.

trans-unit.source: Prerequisites:
trans-unit.target: Prerequisites:

trans-unit.source: Before you begin the instructions in this article, you must have the following:
trans-unit.target: Before you begin the instructions in this article, you must have the following:

trans-unit.source: An Azure subscription.
trans-unit.target: An Azure subscription.

trans-unit.source: See [Get Azure free trial](https://azure.microsoft.com/documentation/videos/get-azure-free-trial-for-testing-hadoop-in-hdinsight/).
trans-unit.target: See [Get Azure free trial](https://azure.microsoft.com/documentation/videos/get-azure-free-trial-for-testing-hadoop-in-hdinsight/).

trans-unit.source: Basic configuration options
trans-unit.target: Basic configuration options

trans-unit.source: The following are the basic configuration options for creating an HDInsight cluster.
trans-unit.target: The following are the basic configuration options for creating an HDInsight cluster.

trans-unit.source: **Cluster name**
trans-unit.target: **Cluster name**

trans-unit.source: Cluster name is used to identify a cluster.
trans-unit.target: Cluster name is used to identify a cluster.

trans-unit.source: Cluster name must follow the following guidelines:
trans-unit.target: Cluster name must follow the following guidelines:

trans-unit.source: The field must be a string that contains between 3 and 63 characters
trans-unit.target: The field must be a string that contains between 3 and 63 characters

trans-unit.source: The field can contain only letters, numbers, and hyphens.
trans-unit.target: The field can contain only letters, numbers, and hyphens.

trans-unit.source: **Subscription name**
trans-unit.target: **Subscription name**

trans-unit.source: An HDInsight cluster is tied to one Azure subscription.
trans-unit.target: An HDInsight cluster is tied to one Azure subscription.

trans-unit.source: **Resource group name**
trans-unit.target: **Resource group name**

trans-unit.source: Azure Resource Manager (ARM) enables you to work with the resources in your application as a group, referred to as an Azure Resource Group.
trans-unit.target: Azure Resource Manager (ARM) enables you to work with the resources in your application as a group, referred to as an Azure Resource Group.

trans-unit.source: You can deploy, update, monitor or delete all of the resources for your application in a single, coordinated operation.
trans-unit.target: You can deploy, update, monitor or delete all of the resources for your application in a single, coordinated operation.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see [Azure Resource Manager Overview](resource-group-overview.md).
trans-unit.target: For more information, see [Azure Resource Manager Overview](resource-group-overview.md).

trans-unit.source: **Operating system**
trans-unit.target: **Operating system**

trans-unit.source: You can create HDInsight clusters on one of the following two operating systems:
trans-unit.target: You can create HDInsight clusters on one of the following two operating systems:

trans-unit.source: **HDInsight on Windows (Windows Server 2012 R2 Datacenter)**:
trans-unit.target: **HDInsight on Windows (Windows Server 2012 R2 Datacenter)**:

trans-unit.source: **HDInsight on Linux (Ubuntu 12.04 LTS for Linux)**: HDInsight provides the option of configuring Linux clusters on Azure.
trans-unit.target: **HDInsight on Linux (Ubuntu 12.04 LTS for Linux)**: HDInsight provides the option of configuring Linux clusters on Azure.

trans-unit.source: Configure a Linux cluster if you are familiar with Linux or Unix, migrating from an existing Linux-based Hadoop solution, or want easy integration with Hadoop ecosystem components built for Linux.
trans-unit.target: Configure a Linux cluster if you are familiar with Linux or Unix, migrating from an existing Linux-based Hadoop solution, or want easy integration with Hadoop ecosystem components built for Linux.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see [Get started with Hadoop on Linux in HDInsight](hdinsight-hadoop-linux-tutorial-get-started.md).
trans-unit.target: For more information, see [Get started with Hadoop on Linux in HDInsight](hdinsight-hadoop-linux-tutorial-get-started.md).

trans-unit.source: **Cluster type** and **cluster size (a.k.a. data nodes)**
trans-unit.target: **Cluster type** and **cluster size (a.k.a. data nodes)**

trans-unit.source: HDInsight allows customers to deploy a variety of cluster types, for different data analytics workloads.
trans-unit.target: HDInsight allows customers to deploy a variety of cluster types, for different data analytics workloads.

trans-unit.source: Cluster types offered today are:
trans-unit.target: Cluster types offered today are:

trans-unit.source: Hadoop clusters: for query and analysis workloads
trans-unit.target: Hadoop clusters: for query and analysis workloads

trans-unit.source: HBase clusters: for NoSQL workloads
trans-unit.target: HBase clusters: for NoSQL workloads

trans-unit.source: Storm clusters: for real time event processing workloads
trans-unit.target: Storm clusters: for real time event processing workloads

trans-unit.source: Spark clusters: for in-memory processing, interactive queries, stream, and machines learning workloads.
trans-unit.target: Spark clusters: for in-memory processing, interactive queries, stream, and machines learning workloads.

trans-unit.source: ![HDInsight clusters](./media/hdinsight-provision-clusters/hdinsight.clusters.png)
trans-unit.target: ![HDInsight clusters](./media/hdinsight-provision-clusters/hdinsight.clusters.png)

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] *Azure HDInsight cluster* is also called *Hadoop clusters in HDInsight*, or *HDInsight cluster*.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] *Azure HDInsight cluster* is also called *Hadoop clusters in HDInsight*, or *HDInsight cluster*.

trans-unit.source: Sometimes, it is used interchangeably with *Hadoop cluster*.
trans-unit.target: Sometimes, it is used interchangeably with *Hadoop cluster*.

trans-unit.source: They all refer to the Hadoop clusters hosted in the Microsoft Azure environment.
trans-unit.target: They all refer to the Hadoop clusters hosted in the Microsoft Azure environment.

trans-unit.source: Within a given cluster type, there are different roles for the various nodes, which allow a customer to size those nodes in a given role appropriate to the details of their workload.
trans-unit.target: Within a given cluster type, there are different roles for the various nodes, which allow a customer to size those nodes in a given role appropriate to the details of their workload.

trans-unit.source: For example, a Hadoop cluster can have its worker nodes created with a large amount of memory if the type of analytics being performed are memory intensive.
trans-unit.target: For example, a Hadoop cluster can have its worker nodes created with a large amount of memory if the type of analytics being performed are memory intensive.

trans-unit.source: ![HDInsight Hadoop cluster roles](./media/hdinsight-provision-clusters/HDInsight.Hadoop.roles.png)
trans-unit.target: ![HDInsight Hadoop cluster roles](./media/hdinsight-provision-clusters/HDInsight.Hadoop.roles.png)

trans-unit.source: Hadoop clusters for HDInsight are deployed with two roles:
trans-unit.target: Hadoop clusters for HDInsight are deployed with two roles:

trans-unit.source: Head node (2 nodes)
trans-unit.target: Head node (2 nodes)

trans-unit.source: Data node (at least 1 node)
trans-unit.target: Data node (at least 1 node)

trans-unit.source: ![HDInsight Hadoop cluster roles](./media/hdinsight-provision-clusters/HDInsight.HBase.roles.png)
trans-unit.target: ![HDInsight Hadoop cluster roles](./media/hdinsight-provision-clusters/HDInsight.HBase.roles.png)

trans-unit.source: HBase clusters for HDInsight are deployed with three roles:
trans-unit.target: HBase clusters for HDInsight are deployed with three roles:

trans-unit.source: Head servers (2 nodes)
trans-unit.target: Head servers (2 nodes)

trans-unit.source: Region servers (at least 1 node)
trans-unit.target: Region servers (at least 1 node)

trans-unit.source: Master/Zookeeper nodes (3 nodes)
trans-unit.target: Master/Zookeeper nodes (3 nodes)

trans-unit.source: ![HDInsight Hadoop cluster roles](./media/hdinsight-provision-clusters/HDInsight.Storm.roles.png)
trans-unit.target: ![HDInsight Hadoop cluster roles](./media/hdinsight-provision-clusters/HDInsight.Storm.roles.png)

trans-unit.source: Storm clusters for HDInsight are deployed with three roles:
trans-unit.target: Storm clusters for HDInsight are deployed with three roles:

trans-unit.source: Nimbus nodes (2 nodes)
trans-unit.target: Nimbus nodes (2 nodes)

trans-unit.source: Supervisor servers (at least 1 node)
trans-unit.target: Supervisor servers (at least 1 node)

trans-unit.source: Zookeeper nodes (3 nodes)
trans-unit.target: Zookeeper nodes (3 nodes)

trans-unit.source: **HDInsight version**
trans-unit.target: **HDInsight version**

trans-unit.source: It is used to determine the version of HDInsight to use for this cluster.
trans-unit.target: It is used to determine the version of HDInsight to use for this cluster.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see [Hadoop cluster versions and components in HDInsight](https://go.microsoft.com/fwLink/?LinkID=320896&clcid=0x409)
trans-unit.target: For more information, see [Hadoop cluster versions and components in HDInsight](https://go.microsoft.com/fwLink/?LinkID=320896&clcid=0x409)

trans-unit.source: **Location (Region)**
trans-unit.target: **Location (Region)**

trans-unit.source: HDInsight cluster and its default storage account must be located on the same Azure location.
trans-unit.target: HDInsight cluster and its default storage account must be located on the same Azure location.

trans-unit.source: ![Azure regions](./media/hdinsight-provision-clusters/Azure.regions.png)
trans-unit.target: ![Azure regions](./media/hdinsight-provision-clusters/Azure.regions.png)

trans-unit.source: For a list of supported regions, click the **Region** drop-down list on [HDInsight pricing](https://go.microsoft.com/fwLink/?LinkID=282635&clcid=0x409).
trans-unit.target: For a list of supported regions, click the **Region** drop-down list on [HDInsight pricing](https://go.microsoft.com/fwLink/?LinkID=282635&clcid=0x409).

trans-unit.source: **Node size**
trans-unit.target: **Node size**

trans-unit.source: ![hdinsight vm node sizes](./media/hdinsight-provision-clusters/hdinsight.node.sizes.png)
trans-unit.target: ![hdinsight vm node sizes](./media/hdinsight-provision-clusters/hdinsight.node.sizes.png)

trans-unit.source: Select the VM size for the nodes.
trans-unit.target: Select the VM size for the nodes.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see [Sizes for Cloud Services](cloud-services-sizes-specs.md).
trans-unit.target: For more information, see [Sizes for Cloud Services](cloud-services-sizes-specs.md).

trans-unit.source: You can select the size of compute resources used by the cluster.
trans-unit.target: You can select the size of compute resources used by the cluster.

trans-unit.source: For example, if you know that you will be performing operations that need a lot of memory, you may want to select a compute resource with more memory.
trans-unit.target: For example, if you know that you will be performing operations that need a lot of memory, you may want to select a compute resource with more memory.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] The nodes used by your cluster do not count as Virtual Machines, as the Virtual Machines images used for the nodes are an implementation detail of the HDInsight service; however, the compute cores used by the nodes do count against the total number of compute cores available to your subscription.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] The nodes used by your cluster do not count as Virtual Machines, as the Virtual Machines images used for the nodes are an implementation detail of the HDInsight service; however, the compute cores used by the nodes do count against the total number of compute cores available to your subscription.

trans-unit.source: You can see the number of cores that will be used by the cluster, as well as the number of cores available, in the summary section of the Node Pricing Tiers blade when creating an HDInsight cluster.
trans-unit.target: You can see the number of cores that will be used by the cluster, as well as the number of cores available, in the summary section of the Node Pricing Tiers blade when creating an HDInsight cluster.

trans-unit.source: Different cluster types have different node types, number of nodes, and node sizes.
trans-unit.target: Different cluster types have different node types, number of nodes, and node sizes.

trans-unit.source: For example, a Hadoop cluster type has two _head nodes_ and a default of four _data nodes_, while a Storm cluster type has two _nimbus nodes_, three _zookeeper nodes_, and a default of four _supervisor nodes_.
trans-unit.target: For example, a Hadoop cluster type has two _head nodes_ and a default of four _data nodes_, while a Storm cluster type has two _nimbus nodes_, three _zookeeper nodes_, and a default of four _supervisor nodes_.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.IMPORTANT] If you plan on more than 32 worker nodes, either at cluster creation or by scaling the cluster after creation, then you must select a head node size with at least 8 cores and 14GB RAM.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.IMPORTANT] If you plan on more than 32 worker nodes, either at cluster creation or by scaling the cluster after creation, then you must select a head node size with at least 8 cores and 14GB RAM.

trans-unit.source: When using the Azure portal to configure the cluster, the Node size is available through the __Node Pricing Tier__ blade, and will also display the cost associated with the different node sizes.
trans-unit.target: When using the Azure portal to configure the cluster, the Node size is available through the __Node Pricing Tier__ blade, and will also display the cost associated with the different node sizes.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.IMPORTANT] Billing starts once a cluster is created, and only stops when the cluster is deleted.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.IMPORTANT] Billing starts once a cluster is created, and only stops when the cluster is deleted.

trans-unit.source: For more information on pricing, see [HDInsight pricing details](https://azure.microsoft.com/pricing/details/hdinsight/).
trans-unit.target: For more information on pricing, see [HDInsight pricing details](https://azure.microsoft.com/pricing/details/hdinsight/).

trans-unit.source: **HDInsight users**
trans-unit.target: **HDInsight users**

trans-unit.source: The HDInsight clusters allow you to configure two user accounts during provisioning:
trans-unit.target: The HDInsight clusters allow you to configure two user accounts during provisioning:

trans-unit.source: HTTP user.
trans-unit.target: HTTP user.

trans-unit.source: The default user name is admin using the basic configuration on the Azure Portal.
trans-unit.target: The default user name is admin using the basic configuration on the Azure Portal.

trans-unit.source: RDP user (Windows clusters): It is used to connect to the cluster using RDP.
trans-unit.target: RDP user (Windows clusters): It is used to connect to the cluster using RDP.

trans-unit.source: When you create the account, you must set an expiration date that is within 90 days from today.
trans-unit.target: When you create the account, you must set an expiration date that is within 90 days from today.

trans-unit.source: SSH User (Linux clusters): Is used to connect to the cluster using SSH.
trans-unit.target: SSH User (Linux clusters): Is used to connect to the cluster using SSH.

trans-unit.source: You can create additional SSH user accounts after the cluster is created by following the steps in [Use SSH with Linux-based Hadoop on HDInsight from Linux, Unix, or OS X](hdinsight-hadoop-linux-use-ssh-unix.md).
trans-unit.target: You can create additional SSH user accounts after the cluster is created by following the steps in [Use SSH with Linux-based Hadoop on HDInsight from Linux, Unix, or OS X](hdinsight-hadoop-linux-use-ssh-unix.md).

trans-unit.source: **Azure storage account**
trans-unit.target: **Azure storage account**

trans-unit.source: The original HDFS uses of many local disks on the cluster.
trans-unit.target: The original HDFS uses of many local disks on the cluster.

trans-unit.source: HDInsight uses Azure Blob storage instead for data storage.
trans-unit.target: HDInsight uses Azure Blob storage instead for data storage.

trans-unit.source: Azure Blob storage is a robust, general-purpose storage solution that integrates seamlessly with HDInsight.
trans-unit.target: Azure Blob storage is a robust, general-purpose storage solution that integrates seamlessly with HDInsight.

trans-unit.source: Through a Hadoop distributed file system (HDFS) interface, the full set of components in HDInsight can operate directly on structured or unstructured data in Blob storage.
trans-unit.target: Through a Hadoop distributed file system (HDFS) interface, the full set of components in HDInsight can operate directly on structured or unstructured data in Blob storage.

trans-unit.source: Storing data in Blob storage enables you to safely delete the HDInsight clusters that are used for computation without losing user data.
trans-unit.target: Storing data in Blob storage enables you to safely delete the HDInsight clusters that are used for computation without losing user data.

trans-unit.source: During configuration, you must specify an Azure storage account and an Azure Blob storage container on the Azure storage account.
trans-unit.target: During configuration, you must specify an Azure storage account and an Azure Blob storage container on the Azure storage account.

trans-unit.source: Some creation process requires the Azure storage account and the Blob storage container created beforehand.
trans-unit.target: Some creation process requires the Azure storage account and the Blob storage container created beforehand.

trans-unit.source: The Blob storage container is used as the default storage location by the cluster.
trans-unit.target: The Blob storage container is used as the default storage location by the cluster.

trans-unit.source: Optionally, you can specify additional Azure Storage accounts (linked storage) that will be accessible by the cluster.
trans-unit.target: Optionally, you can specify additional Azure Storage accounts (linked storage) that will be accessible by the cluster.

trans-unit.source: In addition, the cluster can also access any Blob containers that are configured with full public read access or pulic read access for blobs only.
trans-unit.target: In addition, the cluster can also access any Blob containers that are configured with full public read access or pulic read access for blobs only.

trans-unit.source: For more information on the restrict access, see [Manage Access to Azure Storage Resources](storage-manage-access-to-resources.md).
trans-unit.target: For more information on the restrict access, see [Manage Access to Azure Storage Resources](storage-manage-access-to-resources.md).

trans-unit.source: ![HDInsight storage](./media/hdinsight-provision-clusters/HDInsight.storage.png)
trans-unit.target: ![HDInsight storage](./media/hdinsight-provision-clusters/HDInsight.storage.png)

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] A Blob storage container provides a grouping of a set of blobs as shown in the image:
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] A Blob storage container provides a grouping of a set of blobs as shown in the image:

trans-unit.source: ![Azure blob storage](./media/hdinsight-provision-clusters/Azure.blob.storage.jpg)
trans-unit.target: ![Azure blob storage](./media/hdinsight-provision-clusters/Azure.blob.storage.jpg)

trans-unit.source: **Hive/Oozie metastore**
trans-unit.target: **Hive/Oozie metastore**

trans-unit.source: The metastore contains Hive and Oozie metadata, such as Hive tables, partitions, schemas, and columns.
trans-unit.target: The metastore contains Hive and Oozie metadata, such as Hive tables, partitions, schemas, and columns.

trans-unit.source: Using the metastore helps you to retain your Hive and Oozie metadata, so that you don't need to re-create Hive tables or Oozie jobs when you create a new cluster.
trans-unit.target: Using the metastore helps you to retain your Hive and Oozie metadata, so that you don't need to re-create Hive tables or Oozie jobs when you create a new cluster.

trans-unit.source: By default, Hive uses an embedded Azure SQL database to store this information.
trans-unit.target: By default, Hive uses an embedded Azure SQL database to store this information.

trans-unit.source: The embedded database can't preserve the metadata when the cluster is deleted.
trans-unit.target: The embedded database can't preserve the metadata when the cluster is deleted.

trans-unit.source: For example, you have a cluster created with a Hive metastore.
trans-unit.target: For example, you have a cluster created with a Hive metastore.

trans-unit.source: You created some Hive tables.
trans-unit.target: You created some Hive tables.

trans-unit.source: After you delete the cluster, and recreat the cluster using the same Hive metastore, you will be able to see the Hive tables you created in the original cluster.
trans-unit.target: After you delete the cluster, and recreat the cluster using the same Hive metastore, you will be able to see the Hive tables you created in the original cluster.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] Metastore configuration is not available for HBase cluster types.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] Metastore configuration is not available for HBase cluster types.

trans-unit.source: Customize clusters using HDInsight cluster customization (bootstrap)
trans-unit.target: Customize clusters using HDInsight cluster customization (bootstrap)

trans-unit.source: Sometimes, you want to configure the configuration files:
trans-unit.target: Sometimes, you want to configure the configuration files:

trans-unit.source: core-site.xml
trans-unit.target: core-site.xml

trans-unit.source: hdfs-site.xml
trans-unit.target: hdfs-site.xml

trans-unit.source: mapred-site.xml
trans-unit.target: mapred-site.xml

trans-unit.source: yarn-site.xml
trans-unit.target: yarn-site.xml

trans-unit.source: hive-site.xml
trans-unit.target: hive-site.xml

trans-unit.source: oozie-site.xml
trans-unit.target: oozie-site.xml

trans-unit.source: The clusters can't retain the changes due to re-image.
trans-unit.target: The clusters can't retain the changes due to re-image.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see [Role Instance Restarts Due to OS Upgrades](http://blogs.msdn.com/b/kwill/archive/2012/09/19/role-instance-restarts-due-to-os-upgrades.aspx).
trans-unit.target: For more information, see [Role Instance Restarts Due to OS Upgrades](http://blogs.msdn.com/b/kwill/archive/2012/09/19/role-instance-restarts-due-to-os-upgrades.aspx).

trans-unit.source: To keep the changes through the clusters' lifetime, you can use HDInsight cluster customization during the creation process.
trans-unit.target: To keep the changes through the clusters' lifetime, you can use HDInsight cluster customization during the creation process.

trans-unit.source: This is the recommended way to change configurations of a cluster and persist across these Azure reimage reboot restart events.
trans-unit.target: This is the recommended way to change configurations of a cluster and persist across these Azure reimage reboot restart events.

trans-unit.source: These configuration changes are applied before service start, so services needn’t be restarted.
trans-unit.target: These configuration changes are applied before service start, so services needn’t be restarted.

trans-unit.source: For more a sample, see [Customize HDInsight clusters using Bootstrap](hdinsight-hadoop-customize-cluster-bootstrap.md).
trans-unit.target: For more a sample, see [Customize HDInsight clusters using Bootstrap](hdinsight-hadoop-customize-cluster-bootstrap.md).

trans-unit.source: Customize clusters using Script action
trans-unit.target: Customize clusters using Script action

trans-unit.source: You can install additional components or customize cluster configuration by using scripts during creation.
trans-unit.target: You can install additional components or customize cluster configuration by using scripts during creation.

trans-unit.source: Such scripts are invoked via **Script Action**, which is a configuration option that can be used from the Portal, HDInsight Windows PowerShell cmdlets, or the HDInsight .NET SDK.
trans-unit.target: Such scripts are invoked via **Script Action**, which is a configuration option that can be used from the Portal, HDInsight Windows PowerShell cmdlets, or the HDInsight .NET SDK.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see [Customize HDInsight cluster using Script Action](hdinsight-hadoop-customize-cluster.md).
trans-unit.target: For more information, see [Customize HDInsight cluster using Script Action](hdinsight-hadoop-customize-cluster.md).

trans-unit.source: Use Azure virtual networks
trans-unit.target: Use Azure virtual networks

trans-unit.source: [Azure Virtual Network](https://azure.microsoft.com/documentation/services/virtual-network/) allows you to create a secure, persistent network containing the resources you need for your solution.
trans-unit.target: [Azure Virtual Network](https://azure.microsoft.com/documentation/services/virtual-network/) allows you to create a secure, persistent network containing the resources you need for your solution.

trans-unit.source: A virtual network allows you to:
trans-unit.target: A virtual network allows you to:

trans-unit.source: Connect cloud resources together in a private network (cloud-only).
trans-unit.target: Connect cloud resources together in a private network (cloud-only).

trans-unit.source: ![diagram of cloud-only configuration](./media/hdinsight-provision-clusters/hdinsight-vnet-cloud-only.png)
trans-unit.target: ![diagram of cloud-only configuration](./media/hdinsight-provision-clusters/hdinsight-vnet-cloud-only.png)

trans-unit.source: Connect your cloud resources to your local data-center network (site-to-site or point-to-site) by using a virtual private network (VPN).
trans-unit.target: Connect your cloud resources to your local data-center network (site-to-site or point-to-site) by using a virtual private network (VPN).

trans-unit.source: Site-to-site configuration allows you to connect multiple resources from your data center to the Azure virtual network by using a hardware VPN or the Routing and Remote Access Service.
trans-unit.target: Site-to-site configuration allows you to connect multiple resources from your data center to the Azure virtual network by using a hardware VPN or the Routing and Remote Access Service.

trans-unit.source: ![diagram of site-to-site configuration](./media/hdinsight-provision-clusters/hdinsight-vnet-site-to-site.png)
trans-unit.target: ![diagram of site-to-site configuration](./media/hdinsight-provision-clusters/hdinsight-vnet-site-to-site.png)

trans-unit.source: Point-to-site configuration allows you to connect a specific resource to the Azure virtual network by using a software VPN.
trans-unit.target: Point-to-site configuration allows you to connect a specific resource to the Azure virtual network by using a software VPN.

trans-unit.source: ![diagram of point-to-site configuration](./media/hdinsight-provision-clusters/hdinsight-vnet-point-to-site.png)
trans-unit.target: ![diagram of point-to-site configuration](./media/hdinsight-provision-clusters/hdinsight-vnet-point-to-site.png)

trans-unit.source: For information on using HDInsight with a Virtual Network, including specific configuration requirements for the Virtual Network, see [Extend HDInsight capbilities by using an Azure Virtual Network](hdinsight-extend-hadoop-virtual-network.md).
trans-unit.target: For information on using HDInsight with a Virtual Network, including specific configuration requirements for the Virtual Network, see [Extend HDInsight capbilities by using an Azure Virtual Network](hdinsight-extend-hadoop-virtual-network.md).

trans-unit.source: Cluster creation methods
trans-unit.target: Cluster creation methods

trans-unit.source: In this article, you have learned basic information about creating a Windows-based HDInsight cluster.
trans-unit.target: In this article, you have learned basic information about creating a Windows-based HDInsight cluster.

trans-unit.source: Use the table below to find specific information on how to create a cluster using a method that best suits your needs:
trans-unit.target: Use the table below to find specific information on how to create a cluster using a method that best suits your needs:

trans-unit.source: Use this to create a cluster...
trans-unit.target: Use this to create a cluster...

trans-unit.target: Using a web browser...

trans-unit.target: Using a command-line

trans-unit.target: Using the REST API

trans-unit.target: Using an SDK

trans-unit.target: From Linux, Mac OS X, or Unix

trans-unit.target: From Windows
